Article.title: Still dangerous after all these years, police say
Article.Description: TEXAS CITY — For 20 years, Joe Howell worked as a sergeant for the Galveston County Sheriff’s Office’s Criminal Investigations Division collecting intelligence and studying just how the Bandido motorcycle gang lived and worked.
Article.MainBody: Monday Notebook Podcast: Santa Fe, Clear Creek continue playoff quests James LaCombe and Anthony Oppermann break down the thrilling playoff series victories for the Santa Fe softball and Clear Creek baseball teams and discuss the keys for both squads as they advance in the postseason. Article.title: Sheriff’s office to implement new drug testing policy
Article.Description: The Galveston County Sheriff’s Office is starting to drug test its employees every month — a policy that’s more stringent than most, but comes later than other county law enforcement agencies.

Article.title: Video of Texas City officer-involved shooting released
Article.Description: The Galveston County District Attorney’s Office released video footage Friday that shows the Dec. 26, 2014, fatal shooting of Carlton Wayne Smith Jr. outside H.T.’s Lounge.

Article.title: Texas City school buses involved in accident
Article.Description: TEXAS CITY — Two Texas City school buses were involved in a minor accident Thursday morning while parking at Schlitterbahn during the choir field trip, district spokeswoman Melissa Tortorici said.

Article.title: Dickinson man sentenced for attempted stabbing of EMT
Article.Description: DICKINSON - A Dickinson man pleaded guilty to five felony charges Monday including attempted assault of a public servant for stabbing an EMT with an IV needle.

Article.title: Three rescued from grounded boat
Article.Description: GALVESTON — A U.S. Coast Guard helicopter crew rescued a man and Galveston Island Beach Patrol rescued two others Tuesday after a disabled boat drifted onto the South Galveston Jetty.

Article.title: 15 pounds of cocaine wash ashore on West End
Article.Description: GALVESTON - About 15 pounds of cocaine, which police say has a street value of more than $175,000, washed up on a Galveston beach Sunday.
